segment.source: Overview about Group Policy, the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC), and Internet Explorer 11
segment.target: Overview about Group Policy, the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC), and Internet Explorer 11

segment.source: Group Policy, the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC), and Internet Explorer 11 (Internet Explorer 11 for IT Pros)
segment.target: Group Policy, the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC), and Internet Explorer 11 (Internet Explorer 11 for IT Pros)

segment.source: Group Policy, the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC), and Internet Explorer 11
segment.target: Group Policy, the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC), and Internet Explorer 11

segment.source: A Microsoft Management Console (MMC)-based tool that uses scriptable interfaces to manage Group Policy.
segment.target: A Microsoft Management Console (MMC)-based tool that uses scriptable interfaces to manage Group Policy.

segment.source: The 32-bit and 64-bit versions are included with Windows Server R2 with Service Pack 1 (SP1) and Windows Server 2012 R2.
segment.target: The 32-bit and 64-bit versions are included with Windows Server R2 with Service Pack 1 (SP1) and Windows Server 2012 R2.

segment.source: Why use the GPMC?
segment.target: Why use the GPMC?

segment.source: The GPMC lets you:
segment.target: The GPMC lets you:

segment.source: Import, export, copy, paste, backup and restore GPOs.
segment.target: Import, export, copy, paste, backup and restore GPOs.

segment.source: Search for existing GPOs.
segment.target: Search for existing GPOs.

segment.source: Create reports, including providing the Resultant Set of Policy (RSoP) data in HTML reports that you can save and print.
segment.target: Create reports, including providing the Resultant Set of Policy (RSoP) data in HTML reports that you can save and print.

segment.source: Use simulated RSoP data to prototype your Group Policy before implementing it in the production environment.
segment.target: Use simulated RSoP data to prototype your Group Policy before implementing it in the production environment.

segment.source: Obtain RSoP data to view your GPO interactions and to troubleshoot your Group Policy deployment.
segment.target: Obtain RSoP data to view your GPO interactions and to troubleshoot your Group Policy deployment.

segment.source: Create migration tables to let you import and copy GPOs across domains and across forests.
segment.target: Create migration tables to let you import and copy GPOs across domains and across forests.

segment.source: Migration tables are files that map references to users, groups, computers, and Universal Naming Convention (UNC) paths in the source GPO to new values in the destination GPO.
segment.target: Migration tables are files that map references to users, groups, computers, and Universal Naming Convention (UNC) paths in the source GPO to new values in the destination GPO.

segment.source: Create scriptable interfaces to support all of the operations available within the GPMC.
segment.target: Create scriptable interfaces to support all of the operations available within the GPMC.

segment.source: You can't use scripts to edit individual policy settings in a GPO.
segment.target: You can't use scripts to edit individual policy settings in a GPO.

segment.source: For more information about the GPMC, see Group Policy Management Console on TechNet.
segment.target: For more information about the GPMC, see Group Policy Management Console on TechNet.

segment.source: Searching for Group Policy settings
segment.target: Searching for Group Policy settings

segment.source: To search for Group Policy settings in the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC), use the Group Policy Search tool.
segment.target: To search for Group Policy settings in the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC), use the Group Policy Search tool.

segment.source: To find the Group Policy settings, click Windows Components, and then click Internet Explorer.
segment.target: To find the Group Policy settings, click Windows Components, and then click Internet Explorer.
